SAT Reasoning/ACT Plus Writing
tasks.notes:
Submit your official test scores for the SAT Reasoning OR the ACT plus Writing electronically.

All final, official results must be received by July 15th.

To request your scores, contact the College Board online at http://www.CollegeBoard.com, via phone at (866) 756-7346 OR the ACT online at www.ACTstudent.org, via phone at (319) 337-1313 for score report information.
tasks.subTitle: Office of Undergraduate Admissions

tasks.title: Fall Transcript
tasks.notes:
Please submit final, official transcripts for all colleges/universities in which you have been enrolled in Fall 2016.

Your final, official transcript(s) must be postmarked by December 15th.

The University of California, Berkeley accepts electronic transcripts.  Take steps to find out if your college issues electronic transcripts.

If your school does not issue electronic transcripts, you may mail official transcripts to:
     UC Berkeley Undergraduate Admissions Transcripts
     16 Sproul Hall, MC 0608 
     Berkeley, CA 94720-0608
tasks.subTitle: Michelle Caruso

tasks.title: Final High School Transcript
tasks.notes:
Please submit your final transcript(s) from all high schools/secondary schools for years 9-12.  The transcript must include the date of graduation and verify your self-reported academic record.

ALL final, official documents must be postmarked by July 1st.

You may mail official documents to:

     UC Berkeley Undergraduate Admissions Transcripts
     16 Sproul Hall, MC 0608 
     Berkeley, CA 94720-0608

tasks.title: Accept Your Offer of Admission
tasks.notes:
Accept your Offer of Admission in CalCentral by 11:59pm PDT on your deadline.     

If you are required to pay the SIR Deposit, know that the $250.00 fee is non-refundable.                         
                                                                                                                                               
More information about UC Berkeley's Honor Code can be found here:  https://asuc.org/honorcode/

Review your Conditions of Admission here:  
https://apply.berkeley.edu/apply/status

tasks.subTitle: Michelle Caruso

tasks.title: Print Your Class Schedule Now
tasks.notes:
CalCentral will be unavailable from July 1 to July 4, 2017. As soon as possible, by Friday, June 30, please print, take a screenshot, or make a copy of your Summer Session D class schedule. Summer Session D starts on Monday, July 3.
 
Visit http://sis.berkeley.edu/9-2-upgrade for details. 
—
Summer Session D starts on Monday, July 3, 2017 and CalCentral will be down from 12:01 a.m. Saturday, July 1 to 11:59 p.m. Tuesday, July 4, 2017.
 
You will NOT be able to access your personal class schedule in CalCentral during the weekend prior to the first day of Summer Session D classes.
 
The Berkeley Academic Guide (http://classes.berkeley.edu/) will be available during the CalCentral outage. You can use this website while CalCentral is down to search for general UC Berkeley class information, such as meeting time and location. However, your personal class schedule is not posted on the Berkeley Academic Guide.
 
For Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) and more information about the CalCentral system outage, please visit CalCentral 9.2 Upgrade (http://sis.berkeley.edu/9-2-upgrade).
 
CalCentral will be back online Wednesday, July 5, 2017.

tasks.title: bConnected
tasks.notes: bConnected gives you the official Berkeley email, calendaring, and document sharing services that are used across campus. Instructors, staff, fellow students, and employers use the @berkeley.edu email address to ensure they are communicating with members of the Berkeley community.

tasks.title: Cal 1 Card Photo ID Card
tasks.notes:
The Cal 1 Card is the required official campus photo ID. The first step in obtaining a Cal 1 Card is to carefully review the applicable online photo submission instructions and submit a compliant photo here: https://cal1card.berkeley.edu/c1cphoto).  

Cal 1 Card issuance will occur when you arrive on campus. At that time, you will also be required to present an original valid government-issued photo ID (e.g. driver license, state ID, passport). Please be advised that a high school ID is not a valid government-issued photo ID. 

If you encounter problems successfully uploading a compliant photo online or are unable to obtain a valid government-issued photo ID in advance of your arrival, please provide the pertinent details in an email to cal1card@berkeley.edu.
tasks.subTitle: Michelle Caruso

tasks.title: Berkeley CalNet ID
tasks.notes: In order to access UC Berkeley online services, you will need to establish your online identity — your CalNet ID and associated passphrase. Click below to get started.
tasks.subTitle: Cal 1 Card Office

tasks.title: Golden Bear Advising: CED
tasks.notes:
Golden Bear Advising is an interactive online program designed to introduce you to the academic culture of UC Berkeley. In the program, you will be given campus and college-specific resources, connect with fellow incoming students and submit a proposed course plan for your first semester. 
 
You must complete Golden Bear Advising in order to connect with your academic adviser and enroll in your first semester of courses.
 
To access Golden Bear Advising, log into bcourses.berkeley.edu using your CalNet ID and password. 

If you are unable to access Golden Bear Advising, please contact New Student Services.
nss@berkeley.edu 510.642.7733.
tasks.subTitle: College of Environmental Design

tasks.title: Parent Information Form
tasks.notes:
Your family is an important part of the Cal community. Please complete this form so the university can communicate important campus information, news and events to your parents/family/loved ones, including information about billing and payment services, Golden Bear Orientation and Move-In.  

To complete the form, click the button below.
tasks.subTitle: UDAR API

tasks.title: "Think About It" Training
tasks.notes:
UC Berkeley is committed to creating a safe environment and providing education to address issues of sexual violence in our community. Think About It, an interactive online education platform, is only one part of our comprehensive interpersonal violence prevention program. The module will help you understand related University policies, campus resources, and ways in which you can be an active bystander and community leader in preventing harassment and violence in our community. To complete the module, go to the website listed below and input your Berkeley email address. You will then be prompted to submit your CalNet ID and password.

If you are unable to access the Think About It module, please contact New Student Services via email at nss@berkeley.edu.

Students who do not complete the module will not be able to register for classes during their second semester (Spring 2019).

tasks.title: Apply for Housing
tasks.notes:
Whether you live in a high-rise residence hall with friends, with family in university family housing, or in an off-campus apartment, your home at UC Berkeley is an important - and exciting - part of your college experience. Review the options available for you on the Housing website: link to: http://housing2.berkeley.edu. Housing application deadline for Freshmen including Fall Program for Freshmen (FPF) admits is May 2. 

Please go to the Housing portal to submit your housing application. Contact the Housing Office at 510-642-4108 or reshall@berkeley.edu if you have any questions.  If you believe you may need a housing accommodation for a disability or have a special request related to one of your identities, please complete step 6 of the housing application. Please note that Cal Housing's ability to most appropriately address your needs could depend on you filling out this section by the housing application deadline.                                                                                                               

The University of California recommends that students consider purchasing renters insurance if living away from home. Renters insurance is not mandatory, and may be purchased from any source. As a service to assist students who wish to acquire renters insurance, UC has partnered with GradGuard to provide a renters insurance option for UC students to shop for coverage directly. Students will be able to sign up for renters insurance as a part of the housing contract acceptance process.
tasks.subTitle: SAIT Starez API

tasks.title: Rec Sports Waiver
tasks.notes: With the passage of the 2015 Wellness Referendum Fee, all UC Berkeley undergraduate and graduate students are granted memberships to the Cal Recreational Sports Facility. Please sign the linked waiver to ensure access to our facilities and services.

tasks.title: AB 540 Affidavit
tasks.notes: Please provide a completed AB 540 (UC Nonresident Tuition Exemption) Application/Affidavit. To print out a copy of the Affidavit, please go to: http://registrar.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/pdf/UCTE_for_Elig_CA_HSGrads.pdf

tasks.title: AB 540 HS Transcript
tasks.notes:
Please provide a copy of your official high school transcript. If you prefer to mail the transcript, please send it to: 

Residence Affairs
Office of the Registrar
120 Sproul Hall,
Berkeley, CA  94720-5404 

(If you are still in high school, please submit your official transcript to Undergraduate Admissions after you have completed all high school courses and graduated.)

tasks.title: Presence Clarification- Parent
tasks.notes: In a Word document, please restate the dates of your parent's physical presence in California.  Provide specific dates, indicating when your parent first arrived in California and any departures from the state for more than a week.  Please also include their purpose and duration of travel.  If your parent has never left California, please indicate the year they came to California or that they have been present in the state since birth (if applicable).

tasks.title: Statement of Legal Residence
tasks.notes:
ALL NEW STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT THE STATEMENT OF LEGAL RESIDENCE.

To determine your residency, you are required to submit the Statement of Legal Residence (SLR). If you do not submit the SLR by the deadline, you will be considered a nonresident and charged over $14,000 (for undergraduates; between $6000 and $8000 for graduate/professional students) for additional nonresident fees per semester (subject to change by the Regents of the University of California and could be affected by increases or reductions in State funding, or other developments).

PLEASE NOTE: Failure to submit the SLR (or a pending residency status) will result in a delay in disbursement of university funds (i.e. financial aid, stipends, etc.).

Legal Residence Information: http://registrar.berkeley.edu/Residency/legalinfo.html
Contact info - Residence Affairs:  orres@berkeley.edu | (510) 642-7209

The SLR will open in a new window/tab. Please close the window/tab when you have saved and/or finished your session.
tasks.subTitle: Residence Affairs Unit

tasks.title: CWUP/PWUP Parent Info
tasks.notes: Please provide documentation confirming that your parent’s primary residence is in California (i.e. current driver’s license, current vehicle registration, taxes from the most recent tax filing year,  utility bills, lease agreement, mortgage payments, pay stubs, letter from employer confirming California employment, gym memberships, etc.).
